intro: Randia anisophylla, commonly known as the broadleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Randia anisophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
